WALLET.TITLE: Galion Universal Wallet
WALLET.ERROR_PREAMBLE: An error occurred when creating your Galion Wallet

NO_GUW.TITLE: Creating your Galion Wallet
NO_GUW.TEXT:
Access multiple blockchains like Ethereum and Bitcoin in a seamless way : the Galion Wallet is the easiest way to make your first step in cryptocurrencies.

Choose a password, we take care of everything else.

ACCOUNTS.INTRO: As we add support for more cryptocurrencies, you will be able to create a wallet for various blockchains in a single click. This action will require you to enter your Galion Wallet password, as we will create a private key and encrypt it with your password. Learn how we keep your keys safe in the Galion Security Notice:

DATA.TITLE: Data
DATA.TEXT:
On the Ethereum Network, data is additional information that can be attached to any transaction.

When calling a smart contract, data is transferred and contains the contract's method to invoke and our desired arguments (parameters), in machine language.

For instance, data could contain:

"Call method Transfer with amount 30 tokens (parameter: amount) and send them to address X (parameter: to)"

NONCE.TITLE: Nonce
NONCE.TEXT:
On the Ethereum network, all your transactions are numbered. This is to prevent multiple executions of the same transaction, and also to prevent double spending.

All addresses have their own nonce, that is also equal to the number of transactions in the account.

GASLIMIT.TITLE: Gas Limit
GASLIMIT.TEXT:
On the Ethereum network, all actions cost gas.

When you send a transaction, you must include a gas limit. If your transaction triggers too many actions, it will run out of gas, and will fail. This mechanism is here to prevent bugged smart contracts to execute infinite loops and eventually empty your account by paying huge amounts of gas (remember, the gas is paid with Ether!).

In other words, the gas limit is the maximum amount of money you are willing to spend in order to achieve what your transaction is about.

GASPRICE.TITLE: Gas Price
GASPRICE.TEXT:
On the Ethereum network, all actions cost gas.

Miners, who include transactions in blocks, pick the transactions that pay the highest gas price in order to cash in a maximum amount of Ether (it is their reward for mining a block).

So, if a lot of people are using the network, you may have to set a higher gas price in order to get your transaction included fast (in the next blocks).

SLIPPAGE.TITLE: Slippage
SLIPPAGE.TEXT:
The slippage rate is a limit you impose. If you asked to exchange 1 "Token A" for 2 "Token B", with a slippage rate of 0.95 (minimum conversion rate 95%), you are sure to get at least 1.9 "Token B", otherwise the transaction will fail (if the price of "Token B" relative to "Token A" dramatically increases).

When volatility is high, you may want to set a lower slippage rate if you want your transaction to pass through. This may result in worse trade rates though.

DAPP_BAR.TITLE: Dapp features
DAPP_BAR.TEXT:
In the Galion interface, you can sign blockchain transactions and call smart contracts to connect to the whole blockchain ecosystem and make trustless exchanges of value.

In other words, the Galion interface has decentralized application (or "Dapp") features.

Multiple signature methods are available, so you should be able to use the Galion interface whatever your preferred wallet is.

DISPLAY_CURRENCY.TITLE: Customizing display currency
DISPLAY_CURRENCY.TEXT:
When you choose a display currency, all values everywhere in the Galion interface will be displayed according to your setting.

It can also be useful if you want to compare your ERC20 tokens against ETH directly instead of comparing them against a fiat currency.

SECURITY.TITLE: Security notice
SECURITY.TEXT:
How do we keep your keys safe ?

When you choose a password for your Galion Wallet, we first hash the password you choose by using Bcrypt in your browser, so your password is never sent to our servers. Then, we hash this value with PBKDF2 algorithm to store it on our servers. This allows us to detect if your enter the wrong password, without actually knowing your password.
During this process, a unique salt is generated for each user and your private keys are encrypted using AES256 with a combination of this unique salt and your password. When you want to sign a transaction, we receive your password and compute if it matches the hashes we have stored. This process takes about a second because these algorithms are specifically designed to be slow (to prevent brute force attacks). If the password's hash matches, we use it to decrypt your private key, and sign a transaction. Your password is then deleted from memory.

In the worst case scenario where a malicious hacker would gain access to our database, they won't be able to sign transactions without your Galion Wallet password, because the times to bruteforce your password are prohibitively long.

For other accounts that require a private API key but for which we still need to be able to automatically poll data, like exchanges, all encryptions are made with 2 keys : one in the (compiled) source code, and one that is stored on the production servers only. So even our developers that can access the source code and database can't decrypt your API private keys. Only a small set of trusted people can access the production servers.
API keys that allow write access will be stored with the same security level as your Galion wallet's private keys (we will have to ask you for a password every time we want to decrypt it).

Access to our production environments are restricted to a small set of IP addresses and access to 3rd party administration interfaces (like our web host) are protected by 2FA.

LOCALTIME.TITLE: Local times
LOCALTIME.TEXT: Everywhere in the Galion interface, all dates and times are displayed in your local timezone.

REFRESHRATES.TITLE: Refresh rates
REFRESHRATES.TEXT:
There are 3 types of periodic tasks on the Galion platform:
Value, Balance, and Operation.

Values are refreshed every 5 minutes. They are sourced on 3rd party APIs like Coinmarketcap or exchanges.

Balances are refreshed every 4 hours. They are sourced on their respective platforms' APIs, using the credentials you provided us. Ethereum accounts are refreshed more often, every 30 minutes. This includes ERC20 tokens.

Operations are refreshed the same way as Balances, except they are on a different refresh cycle because they are costly to fetch. Today they are also refreshed every 4 hours but we may change Balance and Operation's polling periodicity separately in the future. All account types may soon be refreshed on different periodicities in order to refresh services with good APIs more often.

Also, if you are trading through the Galion interface, all Ethereum account's data is refreshed in near real-time so you can follow what's happening.

DASHBOARD_NOPORTFOLIO.TITLE: Welcome aboard !
DASHBOARD_NOPORTFOLIO.TEXT: Ready to sail ? The first step to get you started is to name your first Portfolio. The portfolios are used to keep everything nice and tidy. They are like folders.

PORTFOLIOS_NOPORTFOLIO.TITLE: It's empty in here
PORTFOLIOS_NOPORTFOLIO.TEXT:
You're 2 minutes away from setting up your account.
To get started, name your first Portfolio.

PORTFOLIOS_NOACCOUNT.TITLE: Almost there
PORTFOLIOS_NOACCOUNT.TEXT: Tell us where we can find your data, and you'll start to see some sweet charts!

DASHBOARD_NOACCOUNT.TITLE: Add an account
DASHBOARD_NOACCOUNT.TEXT: Congratulations! Now that we have a place to store your data, tell us where we can find it.

DASHBOARD_NOHISTORY.TITLE: Getting your data...
DASHBOARD_NOHISTORY.TEXT:
Please give us a few minutes to fetch your data and initialize your Galion account. This page will update automatically when your account is ready.

More on account refresh rates:
DASHBOARD_NOHISTORY.TEXT_2: Alternatively, you may see this screen because all the accounts you added to your Galion portfolios are empty. Make sure to add a non-empty account to start seeing some sweet charts !

ETH.TITLE: Sign a tx with your Ledger
ETH.CONNECT_TEXT:
Then open the embedded "Ethereum" app.

Make sure you enabled browser support from the embedded app's settings.
ETH.CONNECT_TEXT_INFO_1: You need to use a browser that supports
ETH.LOADING_ADDRESSES:
Loading addresses...
Make sure you have connected your device properly.
ETH.SEND_ERC20: Transfer ERC20 tokens instead of Ether
ETH.SEND_ETHER: Transfer Ether instead of ERC20 tokens
ETH.TX_SUCCESS: You successfully signed an ETH transaction ! Now, you need to broadcast it to the network so miners can include it in the next blocks.

DELETE_ACCOUNT.TITLE: Remove account ?
DELETE_ACCOUNT.TEXT: If you remove this account, you will not be able to track its assets anymore, unless you add it back.

DELETE_PORTFOLIO.TITLE: Delete portfolio ?
DELETE_PORTFOLIO.TEXT: All accounts in this portfolio will also be deleted.

CREATE_WALLET.TITLE: One last thing
CREATE_WALLET.TEXT: Please make sure to remember your password, we won't have any mean to recover it if you forget it. Your funds will be lost if you forget your password, so this is very important.

MARKETS.TITLE: Markets
MARKETS.NAME: Name
MARKETS.LOADING: Fetching the latest data from coinmarketcap...

EXCHANGE.TITLE: Exchanges powered by
EXCHANGE.INTRO: Quickly exchange Ether and ERC20 tokens and make token-to-token conversions from your Galion account. Powered by the Kyber Network and KyberSwap.
EXCHANGE.INTRO_TOOLTIP: Kyber Network is one the best decentralized liquidity network in the world, recognized for its technical excellence and long reaching vision.
